result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary S Friedlander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to commence forthwith  or consecutive to any other sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program after 6 months of confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $111 subpoena fees

--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses  at least twice per month for the 1st six months upon release from prison
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No Contact with Jessica Friedlander unless both she and Agent approve
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 9:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Zachary S Friedlander in court, in-custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2
Court finds that the Defendant has been properly charged as/convicted as a 2nd or subsequent drug offender

Atty Zarwell requests sentencing at later date & to address bond today, arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies bond modification; Court revokes bond, but does not forfeit $500 cash bond previously posted
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that they would like to proceed with sentencing today; Arguments by Counsel 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Friedlander to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 30 months. This sentence is to commence forthwith or consecutive to any other sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program after 6 months of confinement. 
The Court gives 5 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses at least twice per month for the 1st six months upon release from prison
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No Contact with Jessica Friedlander unless both she and Agent approve
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $111 subpoena fees
APPLY $500 CASH BOND

6 month driver license suspension
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 10:01 am
Plea hearing on April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
duplicate original warrant document received from JESO
Scheduling Notice
Defendant appeared in-custody

Case called at 3:14 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Zachary S Friedlander appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell presents basis for non-appearance last week Thursday
Bond arguments by Atty Flint

Court requires a $2500 CASH bond, (in addition to $500 already on file) with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia to include syringes unless as needed for medical purposes
-No contact with Jessica Friedlander 
Statements by Mr. Friedlander; Court informs parties that it will readdress bond on Thursday
Recess: 3:23 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea Hearing 4/9/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices

Copy of email from Attorney Zarwell to the COurt's JA and DA Happ regarding coversation she had with the def. and entering a plea tot he charge on 4/1/15 at 9:30 am / with notation from Judge Koschnick to add this email to the Court file as it forms part of the basis for the bench warant that was issued.
Extradition forecast

Case called at 9:50am [mo]
This case was scheduled for Plea Hearing today. 
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek on behalf of Attorney Yelena Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary S Friedlander does not appear.
Atty. Svehlek has no explanation for non appearance of Mr. Friedlander.
The Court reviews case history.
The Court indicates that It received notice from Atty. Zarwell that Mr. Friedlander would be entering a Plea today.
ADA Shock motions for the Court to enter a bench warrant.
Atty. Svehlek indicates she has attempted to make contact with Mr. Friedlander via telephone, with no response.
Atty. Svehlek requests the Court hear plea if Mr. Friedlander arrives yet this morning.
The Court authorizes a warrant but stays it at this time, and keeps the Jury Trial on the calendar.
The Court will recall the case after 11:00, if at that time Mr. Friedlander does not appear the warrant will be executed. 
recess: 9:55am 
Case recalled at 11:25am  [mo]
All appearances remain the same.
The Court cancels the Trial date for next week.
The Court authorizes the bench warrant, body only. 
recess: 11:27am
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications

Case called at 3:38 pm [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Zachary S Friedlander in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ: 3 officers and 2 citizen witnesses
Atty Zarwell: No additional witnesses
Counsel agree 1 day is needed for trial
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Zarwell indicates that she needs to clarify with Mr. Friedlander that today is last date to enter plea
off-record: 3:38 - 3:39 pm 
Court further explains to Mr. Friedlander the plea deadline
Atty Zarwell requests the defense be given until tomorrow afternoon to further contemplate settlement
DA Happ: No objection
Court informs parties that if Mr. Friedlander enters a plea, can hear sentencing when Atty Zarwell is available
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Atty Svehlek will cover on Thursday

5 strikes each; 1 alternate
Jurors make take notes & ask questions
DA Happ submits Notice, Motion and Jury Instructions

On Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant:
No Miranda Goodchild Issues - Atty Zarwell indicates that there will be foundation objections

On Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions:
Court finds that Mr. Friedlander has 5 prior convictions for impeachment purposes

Court informs parties that If Mr. Friedlander would like to enter change of plea - will hear matter 4/2/15 at 9:30 am 
Recess: 3:49 pm

NEXT: Atty Zarwell to contact the Court by end of business, 4/1/15, if Mr. Friedlander would like to enter change of plea
